alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 02 at 6:41PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...An intense snow shower will impact portions of south central Missoula, northwestern Granite and north central Ravalli Counties through 730 PM MST... At 638 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking an intense snow shower near Missoula, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Moderate to heavy snow. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Rapid reduction of visibility under the core of moderate snow. Freeze up of sidewalks and roads. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Lolo, Bonner-West Riverside, East Missoula, Florence, Wye, Clinton, and Turah. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 98 and 124. Highway 93 S between mile markers 75 and 94. Highway 200 E between mile markers 0 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
